author: igors
title: Stableshift: efficient AMM exchange
description: 资金使用效率低，价格滑落和无常损失是AMM交易所的常见问题。我们如何在Cardano中解决这个问题？

f6_assessments.q0:
Low capital usage efficiency, price slippage, and impermanent loss are the common problems in AMM exchange that everyone wants to find somewhere that can do. This project is making an AMM protocol to help that problem. The proposer has very detailed info about what features that their services will help with this protocol, which all I believe will affect directly the Defi and the development of Cardano ecosystem, moreover, the proposer also briefs their impact on the challenge metrics. Therefore, this project strongly impacts and is one of the essential ideas we should have in the Cardano ecosystem. 
In addition, the key metrics that the proposer show is definitely aligned with the challenge setting because of they're the number of users, volume and TVL will get.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer provides a very detailed implementation plan with features and technical explanations that can help us understand what is inside the services. 
Moreover, the proposer gives a detailed roadmap that fits what this project will deliver in the detail above. So on, the budget breakdown is reasonable to the plan. 
The only last thing I hope that the proposer could add to this proposal is the potential risk that they can meet when implementing.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposer shows the detailed roadmap that is achievable with their team member's abilities. 
Moreover, the key metrics are clear, and all can help Catalyst community to audit this project. 
More important, the proposer showed a detailed explanation about the features and what they want to be in the solution session that helps everyone can easily understand the advantage this project brings to the ecosystem when succeeds.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is clearly related to the challenge brief and objectives. The problem is well defined as well as the solution with more details in the website and white paper. The solution clearly shows the value to the Cardano ecosystem and to the users. From reviewing many proposals this seems like a strong one, although I am not an expert to evaluate the technology itself. Still, the team explained the solution and compared it to other solutions in a simple and clear way.
f6_assessments.q1: The information about the team is found on the website https://stableshift.finance/ with LinkedIn links. Looks like a strong team with a great experience. It could have been good to specific the engagement with stableshift as team members also have other engamnaents so they are not full time on the project. The team is already working on the solution and has a prototype of the Stableshift protocol for Cardano. The team launched Liquifi protocol in BSC and Ethereum in 2020/21 - it could have been helpful to get more information about this and how it was successful/ not successful. Overall the info in the proposal, website, and white paper show the team has the knowledge and capability to deliver the results. The round map is clearly stated. The budget is defined and reasonable but not clear for what period and deliverable it is related to - is it for the 12months or until Q3 for the launch date? Missing some risks and challenges.
f6_assessments.q2: The KPIs presented are easily auditable with suers, monthly volumes, and TLV. The roadmap also has clear measurable deliverables. It could have been good to explain why Cardano and how you relate to Cardano and the community. Maybe collaborating with community members/IOG will give some more validation and confidence re auditability. I think will be important also to assign some support to the project by Cardano & the community to guarantee the best implementation and it will support the audit as well.

f6_assessments.q0:
Dear voter, do not be overwhelmed by the terminology and technical concepts on which the description of the proposal is based.  The proponents are attempting to explore and make an important contribution to situations that have been dealt with since the 1980s. 40 years of increasingly efficient markets (imagine markets as living organisms that learn from themselves and their environment, that absorb information and make themselves better and better) have not been able to shake off phenomena such as slipage, wide bid-ask spreads that offer opportunities to buy or sell at the worst possible price, and high fees that are the lifeline of an increasingly mediocre and incompetent money management industry when it comes to obtaining the longed-for alpha (Warren Buffet included).   Since the mid 80's it has been more and more clearly understood that: a) these phenomena do not disappear, they are natural to market activity, b) although they do not disappear, they can be controlled, c) the most effective control measure for these phenomena is Liquidity. And liquidity is nothing more than the volume of business, of activity, that a security (a stock, a bond, a barrel of crude oil, a pair of shoes, a box of cereal, a toothbrush, etc. etc. etc.) can generate.  Therefore, illiquid markets will be plagued by the influence of these phenomena.   

Beyond the bad publicity, markets are themselves an art form: they are the pure expression that in the end nobody knows anything, so understanding them is a real mental pressure.  

As time goes by, things change.   Systems that insist on their survival tend to assimilate the changes dictated by the environment, to purify themselves and to adapt.  Markets are such systems.  They accept and will continue to accept change in whatever form it takes. And that includes technological changes like blockchain.  


The proposal is clearly a work of exploring better ways of making markets.  And that will always be fine.  That will always be a critical piece in building healthier markets that are a liberating influence and a force for good for human society.  It is therefore my opinion that the proposal has the potential to have a positive impact on our ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal presents the following material:

- Prototype, which can be accessed through https://cardano.stableshift.finance

- Whitepaper, which can be accessed through https://stableshift.finance/pdf/stableshift-whitepaper.pdf

- Website, which can be accessed through https://stableshift.finance/ and where you can find information such as: Team information, partner companies, roadmap, Stableshift general information, among others.
This material gathers a sufficient body of technical information to determine the impact and feasibility of the proposal. 

On the other hand, the requested budget ($28,000 usd) represents 5.6% of the total budget allocated to the "Boosting Cardano's DeFi" campaign.  A reasonable figure.

The first milestone is set for 3 months after funding, with the following activities: "The Stableshift protocol launched in the Cardano testnet. Browser wallet integration released. Security audit passed."  In my opinion, 3 months is an adequate lead time to evaluate the seriousness with which the proponents are taking their commitments.  The caliber of the results to be evaluated will definitely be a testament of the proposal performance. 

I believe that the proposal presents characteristics on the basis of which one could conclude that implementation of the proposal is a real possibility. 

Note: As a voter, I would request a more detailed exposition of the activities described in the budget.
f6_assessments.q2:
The metrics described in the Definition of Success section can be useful tools for measuring the progress of the proposal.

As a voter, please provide information about of the potential risks to the implementation of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer is seeking to build an AMM protocol based on token portfolios with low price slippage. More explanation of the project is desired, hence my 3 star rating.
f6_assessments.q1: The team have already developed and launched a prototype DApp and therefore are capable of implementing the proposal successfully. The plan is detailed, a few mentioned here as , browser wallet integration; batch order processing to improve the throughput; layer 2 alternative , with detailed explanation of the plan in the proposal. The proposal can be successful with commitment.
f6_assessments.q2: The team outlined the success measures that at the end the Stable shift protocols would have been launched in Cardano testnet and on the Cardano mainnet. The road map is clear giving detailed work schedules for the 2022 quarter 1 to 3 to make auditing easy. The budget is also broken down in details for easy auditing.
